item.value: The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.
The earth is the 3rd planet from the sun and is the 5th largest planet in our solar system. Jupiter is the largest planet.
The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world. It is 828 meters ( 2,717 ft ) tall.
Mount McKinley in Alaska in the highest mountain in America. It is 20,320 ft high.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. It can run at 112 kilometres per hour (70 mph). The average person can run from 12 - 17 miles an hour in sprints, so keep away from cheetahs.
The world's population grows by over 100 million each year.
Mount McKinley in Alaska is the highest mountain in America. It is 20,320 ft high. Alaska is also the largest state in America, it is 656,425 square miles in size.
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).
The elephant is distinguished by its high level of intelligence, interesting behavior, methods of communication and complex social structure.
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters.
On April 30, 1789, George Washington became the first President of the United States.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
Michael Jackson's 1982 Thriller album is the biggest seller of all time. Over 110 millions albums were sold.
On average, Elephants sleep for about 2 hours per day.
The strongest wind ever recorded wind was on Mt Washington, New Hampshire, USA. It was an amazing 231mph.
There are more than 2,700 languages in the world.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
